benchmark_details.name: NUTRI BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: NUTRI BENCH is the first publicly available natural language meal description nutrition benchmark consisting of 11,857 human-verified meal descriptions annotated with macronutrient labels, including carbohydrates, proteins, fats, and calories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of large language models (LLMs) on nutrition estimation from natural language meal descriptions.

data.source: Derived from real-world dietary intake data from the What We Eat in America survey and FAO/WHO GIFT.
data.annotation: Human-verified and annotated with macro-nutrient labels.

methodology.calculation: Mean Absolute Error is calculated based on the deviation of the model responses from the true meal carbohydrates.
methodology.interpretation: A lower MAE indicates better performance in correctly estimating carbohydrates from meal descriptions.
